alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 14 at 6:19PM EST until December 14 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... West central Franklin County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 645 PM EST/545 PM CST/. * At 618 PM EST/518 PM CST/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 14 miles south of Port St. Joe, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Gulf and west central Franklin Counties, including the following locations... Nine Mile, Eleven Mile, Thirteen Mile, Odena and Indian Pass. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
